Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteTreatme.name: messageConfiguration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteTreatme.abstract: The message configuration settings for the treatment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteTreatme.name: sizePercent
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteTreatme.abstract: The allocated percentage of users (segment members) to send the treatment to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteTreatme.name: templateConfiguration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteTreatme.abstract: The message template to use for the treatment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteTreatme.name: treatmentName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteTreatme.abstract: A custom name for the treatment. A treatment is a variation of a campaign that’s used for A/B testing of a campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteSegment.name: dimensions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteSegment.abstract: The criteria that define the dimensions for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteSegment.name: segmentGroups
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteSegment.abstract: The segment group to use and the dimensions to apply to the group’s base segments in order to build the segment. A segment group can consist of zero or more base segments. Your request can include only one segment group.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteSegment.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteSegment.abstract: A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the segment. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.name: activities
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.abstract: A map that contains a set of Activity objects, one object for each activity in the journey. For each Activity object, the key is the unique identifier (string) for an activity and the value is the settings for the activity. An activity identifier can contain a maximum of 100 characters. The characters must be alphanumeric characters.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was created.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.name: limits
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.abstract: The messaging and entry limits for the journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.name: localTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.abstract: Specifies whether the journey’s scheduled start and end times use each participant’s local time. To base the schedule on each participant’s local time, set this value to true.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.name: name
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.abstract: The name of the journey. A journey name can contain a maximum of 150 characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters or symbols, such as underscores (_) or hyphens (-). A journey name can’t contain any spaces.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.name: quietTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.abstract:
The quiet time settings for the journey. Quiet time is a specific time range when a journey doesn’t send messages to participants, if all the following conditions are met:

  • The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint for the participant is set to a valid value.

  • The current time in the participant’s time zone is later than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the journey.

  • The current time in the participant’s time zone is earlier than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the journey.

If any of the preceding conditions isn’t met, the participant will receive messages from the journey, even if quiet time is enabled.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.name: refreshFrequency
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.abstract: The frequency with which Amazon Pinpoint evaluates segment and event data for the journey, as a duration in ISO 8601 format.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.name: startActivity
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.abstract: The unique identifier for the first activity in the journey. The identifier for this activity can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters must be alphanumeric characters.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.name: startCondition
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.abstract: The segment that defines which users are participants in the journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.name: state
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.abstract:
The status of the journey. Valid values are:

  • DRAFT - Saves the journey and doesn’t publish it.

  • ACTIVE - Saves and publishes the journey. Depending on the journey’s schedule, the journey starts running immediately or at the scheduled start time. If a journey’s status is ACTIVE, you can’t add, change, or remove activities from it.

The CANCELLED, COMPLETED, and CLOSED values are not supported in requests to create or update a journey. To cancel a journey, use the Journey State resource.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteEventSt.name: destinationStreamArn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteEventSt.abstract:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis data stream or Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that you want to publish event data to.

For a Kinesis data stream, the ARN format is: arn:aws:kinesis:region:account-id:stream/stream_name

For a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the ARN format is: arn:aws:firehose:region:account-id:deliverystream/stream_name

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteEventSt.name: roleArn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteEventSt.abstract: The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to publish event data to the stream in your AWS account.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.name: additionalTreatments
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.abstract: An array of requests that defines additional treatments for the campaign, in addition to the default treatment for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.name: holdoutPercent
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.abstract: The allocated percentage of users (segment members) who shouldn’t receive messages from the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.name: hook
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.abstract: The settings for the AWS Lambda function to use as a code hook for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.name: isPaused
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.abstract: Specifies whether to pause the campaign. A paused campaign doesn’t run unless you resume it by setting this value to false.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.name: messageConfiguration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.abstract: The message configuration settings for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.name: segmentId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.abstract: The unique identifier for the segment to associate with the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.name: segmentVersion
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.abstract: The version of the segment to associate with the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.name: templateConfiguration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.abstract: The message template to use for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.name: treatmentDescription
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.abstract: A custom description of a variation of the campaign to use for A/B testing.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.name: treatmentName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.abstract: A custom name for a variation of the campaign to use for A/B testing.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.abstract: A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the campaign. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteApplica.name: campaignHook
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteApplica.abstract: The settings for the AWS Lambda function to use by default as a code hook for campaigns in the application. To override these settings for a specific campaign, use the Campaign resource to define custom Lambda function settings for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteApplica.name: cloudWatchMetricsEnabled
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteApplica.abstract: Specifies whether to enable application-related alarms in Amazon CloudWatch.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteApplica.name: limits
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteApplica.abstract: The default sending limits for campaigns in the application. To override these limits for a specific campaign, use the Campaign resource to define custom limits for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteApplica.name: quietTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteApplica.abstract:
The default quiet time for campaigns and journeys in the application. Quiet time is a specific time range when messages aren’t sent to endpoints, if all the following conditions are met:

  • The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set to a valid value.

  • The current time in the endpoint’s time zone is later than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time settings).

  • The current time in the endpoint’s time zone is earlier than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time settings).

If any of the preceding conditions isn’t met, the endpoint will receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is enabled.

To override the default quiet time settings for a specific campaign or journey, use the Campaign resource or the Journey resource to define a custom quiet time for the campaign or journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWaitTime.htm.name: waitFor
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWaitTime.htm.abstract: The amount of time to wait, as a duration in ISO 8601 format, before determining whether the activity’s conditions have been met or moving participants to the next activity in the journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWaitTime.htm.name: waitUntil
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWaitTime.htm.abstract: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Pinpoint determines whether the activity’s conditions have been met or the activity moves participants to the next activity in the journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWaitActivity.name: nextActivity
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWaitActivity.abstract: The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after performing the wait activity.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWaitActivity.name: waitTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWaitActivity.abstract: The amount of time to wait or the date and time when the activity moves participants to the next activity in the journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: arn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: body
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: The text of the script that’s used in messages that are based on the message template, in plain text format.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: defaultSubstitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for message variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: languageCode
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: The code for the language that’s used when synthesizing the text of the script in messages that are based on the message template. For a list of supported languages and the code for each one, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: templateDescription
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: The custom description of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: templateName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: The name of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: templateType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For a voice template, this value is VOICE.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the message template, or the version of the template that you specified by using the version parameter in your request.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: voiceId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: The name of the voice that’s used when delivering messages that are based on the message template. For a list of supported voices, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: body
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: The text of the script to use in messages that are based on the message template, in plain text format.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: defaultSubstitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message that’s based on the template, you can override these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables and values.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: languageCode
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: The code for the language to use when synthesizing the text of the script in messages that are based on the message template. For a list of supported languages and the code for each one, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: templateDescription
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: A custom description of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: voiceId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: The name of the voice to use when delivering messages that are based on the message template. For a list of supported voices, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceMessage.name: body
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceMessage.abstract: The text of the script to use for the voice message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceMessage.name: languageCode
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceMessage.abstract: The code for the language to use when synthesizing the text of the message script. For a list of supported languages and the code for each one, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceMessage.name: originationNumber
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceMessage.abstract: The long code to send the voice message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long codes that’s assigned to your AWS account. Although it isn’t required, we recommend that you specify the long code in E.164 format, for example +12065550100, to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceMessage.name: substitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceMessage.abstract: The default message variables to use in the voice message. You can override the default variables with individual address variables.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceMessage.name: voiceId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceMessage.abstract: The name of the voice to use when delivering the message. For a list of supported voices, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.abstract: The unique identifier for the application that the voice channel applies to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.abstract: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the voice channel was enabled.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.name: enabled
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.abstract: Specifies whether the voice channel is enabled for the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.name: hasCredential
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.abstract: (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.name: identifier
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.abstract: (Deprecated) An identifier for the voice channel. This property is retained only for backward compatibility.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.name: isArchived
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.abstract: Specifies whether the voice channel is archived.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.name: lastModifiedBy
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.abstract: The user who last modified the voice channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.abstract: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the voice channel was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.name: platform
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.abstract: The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For the voice channel, this value is VOICE.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.abstract: The current version of the voice channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.name: enabled
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.abstract: Specifies whether to enable the voice channel for the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceT.name: messageBody
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceT.abstract: Provides information about an API request or response.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceT.name: createNewVersion
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceT.abstract:
Specifies whether to save the updates as a new version of the message template. Valid values are: true, save the updates as a new version; and, false, save the updates to (overwrite) the latest existing version of the template.

If you don’t specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template. If you specify a value of true for this parameter, don’t specify a value for the version parameter. Otherwise, an error will occur.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceT.name: templateName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceT.abstract: The name of the message template. A template name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceT.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceT.abstract:
The unique identifier for the version of the message template to update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers and other information for all the versions of a template, use the Template Versions resource.

If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. If specified for an update operation, this value must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don’t occur.

If you don’t specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does the following:

  • For a get operation, retrieves information about the active version of the template.

  • For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version parameter isn’t used or is set to false.

  • For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all versions of the template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceT.name: voiceTemplateRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceT.abstract: Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be used in messages that are sent through the voice channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceC.name: voiceChannelResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceC.abstract: Provides information about the status and settings of the voice channel for an application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceC.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceC.abstract: The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceC.name: voiceChannelRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateVoiceC.abstract: Specifies the status and settings of the voice channel for an application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateTempla.name: messageBody
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateTempla.abstract: Provides information about an API request or response.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateTempla.name: templateActiveVersionRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateTempla.abstract: Specifies which version of a message template to use as the active version of the template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateTempla.name: templateName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateTempla.abstract: The name of the message template. A template name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateTempla.name: templateType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateTempla.abstract: The type of channel that the message template is designed for. Valid values are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsTem.name: messageBody
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsTem.abstract: Provides information about an API request or response.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsTem.name: createNewVersion
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsTem.abstract:
Specifies whether to save the updates as a new version of the message template. Valid values are: true, save the updates as a new version; and, false, save the updates to (overwrite) the latest existing version of the template.

If you don’t specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template. If you specify a value of true for this parameter, don’t specify a value for the version parameter. Otherwise, an error will occur.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsTem.name: SMSTemplateRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsTem.abstract: Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be used in text messages that are sent through the SMS channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsTem.name: templateName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsTem.abstract: The name of the message template. A template name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsTem.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsTem.abstract:
The unique identifier for the version of the message template to update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers and other information for all the versions of a template, use the Template Versions resource.

If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. If specified for an update operation, this value must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don’t occur.

If you don’t specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does the following:

  • For a get operation, retrieves information about the active version of the template.

  • For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version parameter isn’t used or is set to false.

  • For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all versions of the template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsCha.name: SMSChannelResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsCha.abstract: Provides information about the status and settings of the SMS channel for an application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsCha.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsCha.abstract: The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsCha.name: SMSChannelRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSmsCha.abstract: Specifies the status and settings of the SMS channel for an application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSegmen.name: segmentResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSegmen.abstract: Provides information about the configuration, dimension, and other settings for a segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSegmen.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSegmen.abstract: The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSegmen.name: writeSegmentRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateSegmen.abstract: Specifies the configuration, dimension, and other settings for a segment. A WriteSegmentRequest object can include a Dimensions object or a SegmentGroups object, but not both.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.name: recommenderConfigurationResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.abstract: Provides information about Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for retrieving and processing data from a recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.name: recommenderId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.abstract: The unique identifier for the recommender model configuration. This identifier is displayed as the Recommender ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.name: updateRecommenderConfiguration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.abstract: Specifies Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for retrieving and processing recommendation data from a recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.name: attributes
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.abstract:
A map of key-value pairs that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending on the value for the RecommenderUserIdType property. Each of these attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that’s retrieved from the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda function for additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a message variable in a message template.

In the map, the key is the name of a custom attribute and the value is a custom display name for that attribute. The display name appears in the Attribute finder pane of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The following restrictions apply to these names:

  • An attribute name must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 50 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Attribute names are case sensitive and must be unique.

  • An attribute display name must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).

This object is required if the configuration invokes an AWS Lambda function (LambdaFunctionArn) to process recommendation data. Otherwise, don’t include this object in your request.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.name: detail
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.abstract: A custom description of the configuration for the recommender model. The description can contain up to 128 characters.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.name: name
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.abstract: A custom name of the configuration for the recommender model. The name must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.name: recommendationProviderIdType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.abstract:
The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID to associate with unique user IDs in the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute and event data thats specific to a particular endpoint or user in an Amazon Pinpoint application. Valid values are:

  • PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Associate each user in the model with a particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.

  • PINPOINT_USER_ID - Associate each user in the model with a particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If you specify this value, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify a both a user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages wont be sent to the user’s endpoint.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.name: recommendationProviderRoleArn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve recommendation data from the recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.name: recommendationProviderUri
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model to retrieve recommendation data from. This value must match the ARN of an Amazon Personalize campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.name: recommendationTransformerUri
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.abstract: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that’s retrieved from the recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.name: recommendationsDisplayName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.abstract:
A custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores a recommended item for each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the RecommenderUserIdType property. This value is required if the configuration doesn’t invoke an AWS Lambda function (LambdaFunctionArn) to perform additional processing of recommendation data.

This name appears in the Attribute finder pane of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The name can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). These restrictions don’t apply to attribute values.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.name: recommendationsPerMessage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.abstract:
The number of recommended items to retrieve from the model for each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the RecommenderUserIdType property. This number determines how many recommended attributes are available for use as message variables in message templates. The minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 5. The default value is 5.

To use multiple recommended items and custom attributes with message variables, you have to use an AWS Lambda function (LambdaFunctionArn) to perform additional processing of recommendation data.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdatePushTe.name: messageBody
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdatePushTe.abstract: Provides information about an API request or response.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdatePushTe.name: createNewVersion
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdatePushTe.abstract:
Specifies whether to save the updates as a new version of the message template. Valid values are: true, save the updates as a new version; and, false, save the updates to (overwrite) the latest existing version of the template.

If you don’t specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template. If you specify a value of true for this parameter, don’t specify a value for the version parameter. Otherwise, an error will occur.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdatePushTe.name: pushNotificationTemplateRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdatePushTe.abstract: Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be used in messages that are sent through a push notification channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdatePushTe.name: templateName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdatePushTe.abstract: The name of the message template. A template name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdatePushTe.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdatePushTe.abstract:
The unique identifier for the version of the message template to update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers and other information for all the versions of a template, use the Template Versions resource.

If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. If specified for an update operation, this value must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don’t occur.

If you don’t specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does the following:

  • For a get operation, retrieves information about the active version of the template.

  • For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version parameter isn’t used or is set to false.

  • For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all versions of the template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateJourne.name: journeyResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateJourne.abstract: Provides information about the status, configuration, and other settings for a journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateEmailT.abstract: Provides information about an API request or response.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateEmailT.name: createNewVersion
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateEmailT.abstract:
Specifies whether to save the updates as a new version of the message template. Valid values are: true, save the updates as a new version; and, false, save the updates to (overwrite) the latest existing version of the template.

If you don’t specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template. If you specify a value of true for this parameter, don’t specify a value for the version parameter. Otherwise, an error will occur.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateEmailT.name: emailTemplateRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateEmailT.abstract: Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be used in messages that are sent through the email channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateEmailT.name: templateName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateEmailT.abstract: The name of the message template. A template name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateEmailT.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateEmailT.abstract:
The unique identifier for the version of the message template to update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers and other information for all the versions of a template, use the Template Versions resource.

If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. If specified for an update operation, this value must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don’t occur.

If you don’t specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does the following:

  • For a get operation, retrieves information about the active version of the template.

  • For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version parameter isn’t used or is set to false.

  • For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all versions of the template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.name: message

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.abstract: The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.name: requestID
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.abstract: The unique identifier for the request to retrieve information about all the versions of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the version of the message template was created.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.name: defaultSubstitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.abstract: A JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for message variables in the version of the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the version of the message template was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.name: templateDescription
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.abstract: The custom description of the version of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.name: templateType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.abstract: The type of channel that the message template is designed for. Possible values are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.abstract: The unique identifier for the version of the message template. This value is an integer that Amazon Pinpoint automatically increments and assigns to each new version of a template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.name: arn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template. This value isn’t included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the ARN of a template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you want to retrieve the ARN for.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.name: defaultSubstitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.abstract: The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for message variables in the message template. This object isn’t included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve this object for a template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you want to retrieve the object for.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.name: templateDescription
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.abstract: The custom description of the message template. This value isn’t included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the description of a template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you want to retrieve the description for.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.name: templateType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.abstract: The type of channel that the message template is designed for. Possible values are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.abstract: The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.abstract: A map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated with the message template. This object isn’t included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve this object for a template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you want to retrieve the object for.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateConf.name: emailTemplate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateConf.abstract: The email template to use for the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateConf.name: pushTemplate

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateConf.name: SMSTemplate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateConf.abstract: The SMS template to use for the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateConf.name: voiceTemplate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateConf.abstract: The voice template to use for the message. This object isn’t supported for campaigns.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateActi.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateActi.abstract: The version of the message template to use as the active version of the template. Valid values are: latest, for the most recent version of the template; or, the unique identifier for any existing version of the template. If you specify an identifier, the value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplate.htm.name: name
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplate.htm.abstract: The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the name of an existing message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplate.htm.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplate.htm.abstract:
The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.

If you don’t specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses the active version of the template. The active version is typically the version of a template that’s been most recently reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn’t necessarily the latest version of a template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTagsModel.ht.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTagsModel.ht.abstract:
A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags for an application, campaign, message template, or segment. Each of these resources can have a maximum of 50 tags.

Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value. The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The maximum length of a tag value is 256 characters.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTagResourceR.name: resourceArn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTagResourceR.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTagResourceR.name: tagsModel
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTagResourceR.abstract: Specifies the tags (keys and values) for an application, campaign, message template, or segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingStartConditi.name: segmentStartCondition
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingStartConditi.abstract: The segment that’s associated with the first activity in the journey. This segment determines which users are participants in the journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmailP.name: charset
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmailP.abstract: The applicable character set for the message content.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmailP.name: data
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmailP.abstract: The textual data of the message content.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmail..name: htmlPart
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmail..abstract: The body of the email message, in HTML format. We recommend using HTML format for email clients that render HTML content. You can include links, formatted text, and more in an HTML message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmail..name: subject
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmail..abstract: The subject line, or title, of the email.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmail..name: textPart
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmail..abstract: The body of the email message, in plain text format. We recommend using plain text format for email clients that don’t render HTML content and clients that are connected to high-latency networks, such as mobile devices.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleCondit.name: eventCondition

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleCondit.name: segmentDimensions

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSetDimension.name: dimensionType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSetDimension.abstract: The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are: INCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the criteria are included in the segment; and, EXCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the criteria are excluded from the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSetDimension.name: values
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSetDimension.abstract: The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the value of the DimensionType property, endpoints are included or excluded from the segment if their values match the criteria values.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSession.html.name: duration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSession.html.abstract: The duration of the session, in milliseconds.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSession.html.name: startTimestamp

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSession.html.name: stopTimestamp
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSession.html.abstract: The date and time when the session ended.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.name: sendUsersMessageResponse

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.name: applicationId

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.name: requestId

The object lists user IDs and, for each user ID, provides the endpoint IDs that the message was sent to. For each endpoint ID, it provides an EndpointMessageResult object.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.name: context
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.abstract: A map of custom attribute-value pairs. For a push notification, Amazon Pinpoint adds these attributes to the data.pinpoint object in the body of the notification payload. Amazon Pinpoint also provides these attributes in the events that it generates for users-messages deliveries.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.name: messageConfiguration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.abstract: The settings and content for the default message and any default messages that you defined for specific channels.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.name: templateConfiguration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.abstract: The message template to use for the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.name: traceId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.abstract: The unique identifier for tracing the message. This identifier is visible to message recipients.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.name: users
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.abstract: A map that associates user IDs with EndpointSendConfiguration objects. You can use an EndpointSendConfiguration object to tailor the message for a user by specifying settings such as content overrides and message variables.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendMessages.name: messageResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendMessages.abstract: Provides information about the results of a request to send a message to an endpoint address.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendMessages.name: applicationId
