Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendMessages.name: messageRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendMessages.abstract: Specifies the configuration and other settings for a message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentsResp.name: item
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentsResp.abstract: An array of responses, one for each segment that’s associated with the application (Segments resource) or each version of a segment that’s associated with the application (Segment Versions resource).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentsResp.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentsResp.abstract: The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.abstract: The unique identifier for the application that the segment is associated with.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.name: arn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.abstract: The date and time when the segment was created.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.name: importDefinition
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.abstract: The settings for the import job that’s associated with the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.abstract: The date and time when the segment was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.name: segmentGroups
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.abstract: A list of one or more segment groups that apply to the segment. Each segment group consists of zero or more base segments and the dimensions that are applied to those base segments.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.name: segmentType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.abstract:
The segment type. Valid values are:

  • DIMENSIONAL - A dynamic segment, which is a segment that uses selection criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint data that’s reported by your app. Dynamic segments can change over time.

  • IMPORT - A static segment, which is a segment that uses selection criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint definitions that you import from a file. Imported segments are static; they don’t change over time.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.abstract: A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated with the segment. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentLocat.name: country
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentLocat.abstract: The country or region code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentLocat.name: GPSPoint
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentLocat.abstract: The GPS location and range for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImpor.name: channelCounts
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImpor.abstract: The number of channel types in the endpoint definitions that were imported to create the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImpor.name: externalId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImpor.abstract: (Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value to assume an IAM role when importing endpoint definitions, but we removed this requirement. We don’t recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImpor.name: format
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImpor.abstract: The format of the files that were imported to create the segment. Valid values are: CSV, for comma-separated values format; and, JSON, for newline-delimited JSON format.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImpor.name: roleArn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImpor.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorized Amazon Pinpoint to access the Amazon S3 location to import endpoint definitions from.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImpor.name: s3Url
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImpor.abstract: The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that the endpoint definitions were imported from to create the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImpor.name: size
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImpor.abstract: The number of endpoint definitions that were imported successfully to create the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.name: groups
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.abstract: An array that defines the set of segment criteria to evaluate when handling segment groups for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.name: include
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.abstract: Specifies how to handle multiple segment groups for the segment. For example, if the segment includes three segment groups, whether the resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of the segment groups.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.name: dimensions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.abstract: An array that defines the dimensions for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.name: sourceSegments
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.abstract:
The base segment to build the segment on. A base segment, also referred to as a source segment, defines the initial population of endpoints for a segment. When you add dimensions to a segment, Amazon Pinpoint filters the base segment by using the dimensions that you specify.

You can specify more than one dimensional segment or only one imported segment. If you specify an imported segment, the Amazon Pinpoint console displays a segment size estimate that indicates the size of the imported segment without any filters applied to it.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.name: sourceType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.abstract: Specifies how to handle multiple base segments for the segment. For example, if you specify three base segments for the segment, whether the resulting segment is based on all, any, or none of the base segments.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.name: types
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.abstract: Specifies how to handle multiple dimensions for the segment. For example, if you specify three dimensions for the segment, whether the resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of the dimensions.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimen.name: attributes
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimen.abstract: One or more custom attributes to use as criteria for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimen.name: behavior
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimen.abstract: The behavior-based criteria, such as how recently users have used your app, for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimen.name: demographic
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimen.abstract: The demographic-based criteria, such as device platform, for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimen.name: location
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimen.abstract: The location-based criteria, such as region or GPS coordinates, for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimen.name: metrics
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimen.abstract: One or more custom metrics to use as criteria for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimen.name: userAttributes
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimen.abstract: One or more custom user attributes to use as criteria for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDemog.name: appVersion
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDemog.abstract: The app version criteria for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDemog.name: deviceType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDemog.abstract: The device type criteria for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDemog.name: make
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDemog.abstract: The device make criteria for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDemog.name: model
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDemog.abstract: The device model criteria for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDemog.name: platform
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDemog.abstract: The device platform criteria for the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentCondi.name: segmentId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentCondi.abstract: The unique identifier for the segment to associate with the activity.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentBehav.name: recency
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentBehav.abstract: The dimension settings that are based on how recently an endpoint was active.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.name: endTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.abstract: The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign ended or will end.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.name: eventFilter
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.abstract: The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent, if the value of the Frequency property is EVENT.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.name: frequency
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.abstract: Specifies how often the campaign is sent or whether the campaign is sent in response to a specific event.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.name: isLocalTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.abstract: Specifies whether the start and end times for the campaign schedule use each recipient’s local time. To base the schedule on each recipient’s local time, set this value to true.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.name: quietTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.abstract:
The default quiet time for the campaign. Quiet time is a specific time range when a campaign doesn’t send messages to endpoints, if all the following conditions are met:

  • The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set to a valid value.

  • The current time in the endpoint’s time zone is later than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the campaign.

  • The current time in the endpoint’s time zone is earlier than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the campaign.

If any of the preceding conditions isn’t met, the endpoint will receive messages from the campaign, even if quiet time is enabled.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.name: startTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.abstract: The scheduled time when the campaign began or will begin. Valid values are: IMMEDIATE, to start the campaign immediately; or, a specific time in ISO 8601 format.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.name: timezone
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.abstract: The starting UTC offset for the campaign schedule, if the value of the IsLocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01, UTC+02, UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45, UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10, UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+13, UTC-02, UTC-03, UTC-04, UTC-05, UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-10, and UTC-11.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: arn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: body
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: The message body that’s used in text messages that are based on the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: defaultSubstitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for message variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: recommenderId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: The unique identifier for the recommender model that’s used by the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: templateDescription
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: The custom description of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: templateType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For an SMS template, this value is SMS.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the message template, or the version of the template that you specified by using the version parameter in your request.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: body
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: The message body to use in text messages that are based on the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: defaultSubstitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message that’s based on the template, you can override these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables and values.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: recommenderId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that use the template, if the template contains message variables for recommendation data.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: templateDescription
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: A custom description of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage.h.name: keyword
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage.h.abstract: The SMS program name that you provided to AWS Support when you requested your dedicated number.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage.h.name: mediaUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage.h.abstract: The URL of an image or video to display in the SMS message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage.h.name: messageType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage.h.abstract: The SMS message type. Valid values are: TRANSACTIONAL, the message is critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time password that supports a customer transaction; and, PROMOTIONAL, the message is not critical or time-sensitive, such as a marketing message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage.h.name: originationNumber
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage.h.abstract: The number to send the SMS message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long or short codes that’s assigned to your AWS account. If you don’t specify a long or short code, Amazon Pinpoint assigns a random long code to the SMS message and sends the message from that code.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage.h.name: senderId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage.h.abstract: The sender ID to display as the sender of the message on a recipient’s device. Support for sender IDs varies by country or region.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage.h.name: substitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage.h.abstract: The message variables to use in the SMS message. You can override the default variables with individual address variables.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: The unique identifier for the application that the SMS channel applies to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the SMS channel was enabled.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: enabled
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: Specifies whether the SMS channel is enabled for the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: hasCredential
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: identifier
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: (Deprecated) An identifier for the SMS channel. This property is retained only for backward compatibility.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: isArchived
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: Specifies whether the SMS channel is archived.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: lastModifiedBy
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: The user who last modified the SMS channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the SMS channel was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: platform
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For the SMS channel, this value is SMS.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: promotionalMessagesPerSecond
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: The maximum number of promotional messages that you can send through the SMS channel each second.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: senderId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: The identity that displays on recipients’ devices when they receive messages from the SMS channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: shortCode
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: The registered short code to use when you send messages through the SMS channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: transactionalMessagesPerSecond
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: The maximum number of transactional messages that you can send through the SMS channel each second.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: The current version of the SMS channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: enabled
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: Specifies whether to enable the SMS channel for the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: senderId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: The identity that you want to display on recipients’ devices when they receive messages from the SMS channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: shortCode
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: The registered short code that you want to use when you send messages through the SMS channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingResultRowVal.name: key
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingResultRowVal.abstract: The friendly name of the metric whose value is specified by the Value property.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingResultRowVal.name: types
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingResultRowVal.abstract: The data type of the value specified by the Value property.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingResultRowVal.name: value
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingResultRowVal.abstract: In a Values object, the value for the metric that the query retrieved data for. In a GroupedBys object, the value for the field that was used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results (Values objects).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingResultRow.ht.name: groupedBys
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingResultRow.ht.abstract: An array of objects that defines the field and field values that were used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results. This value is null if the data in a result set isnt grouped.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingResultRow.ht.name: values
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingResultRow.ht.abstract: An array of objects that provides pre-aggregated values for a standard metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRemoveAttrib.name: attributesResource
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRemoveAttrib.abstract: Provides information about the type and the names of attributes that were removed from all the endpoints that are associated with an application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRemoveAttrib.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRemoveAttrib.abstract: The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRemoveAttrib.name: attributeType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRemoveAttrib.abstract:
The type of attribute or attributes to remove. Valid values are:

  • endpoint-custom-attributes - Custom attributes that describe endpoints, such as the date when an associated user opted in or out of receiving communications from you through a specific type of channel.

  • endpoint-metric-attributes - Custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint for endpoints, such as the number of app sessions or the number of items left in a cart.

  • endpoint-user-attributes - Custom attributes that describe users, such as first name, last name, and age.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRemoveAttrib.name: updateAttributesRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRemoveAttrib.abstract: Specifies one or more attributes to remove from all the endpoints that are associated with an application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.name: attributes
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.abstract:
A map that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending on the value for the RecommenderUserIdType property. Each of these attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that’s retrieved from the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda function for additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a message variable in a message template.

This value is null if the configuration doesn’t invoke an AWS Lambda function (LambdaFunctionArn) to perform additional processing of recommendation data.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.abstract: The date, in extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration was created for the recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.name: detail
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.abstract: The custom description of the configuration for the recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.name: identifier
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.abstract: The unique identifier for the recommender model configuration.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.abstract: The date, in extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration for the recommender model was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.name: name
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.abstract: The custom name of the configuration for the recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.name: recommendationProviderIdType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.abstract:
The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID that’s associated with unique user IDs in the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute and event data thats specific to a particular endpoint or user in an Amazon Pinpoint application. Possible values are:

  • PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.

  • PINPOINT_USER_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If this value is specified, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify both a user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages wont be sent to the user’s endpoint.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.name: recommendationProviderRoleArn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve recommendation data from the recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.name: recommendationProviderUri
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model that Amazon Pinpoint retrieves the recommendation data from. This value is the ARN of an Amazon Personalize campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.name: recommendationTransformerUri
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.abstract: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that Amazon Pinpoint invokes to perform additional processing of recommendation data that it retrieves from the recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.name: recommendationsDisplayName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.abstract:
The custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores a recommended item for each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the RecommenderUserIdType property. This name appears in the Attribute finder pane of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

This value is null if the configuration doesn’t invoke an AWS Lambda function (LambdaFunctionArn) to perform additional processing of recommendation data.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.name: recommendationsPerMessage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.abstract: The number of recommended items that are retrieved from the model for each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the RecommenderUserIdType property. This number determines how many recommended attributes are available for use as message variables in message templates.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecencyDimen.name: duration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecencyDimen.abstract: The duration to use when determining whether an endpoint is active or inactive.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecencyDimen.name: recencyType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecencyDimen.abstract: The type of recency dimension to use for the segment. Valid values are: ACTIVE, endpoints that were active within the specified duration are included in the segment; and, INACTIVE, endpoints that weren’t active within the specified duration are included in the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRawEmail.htm.name: data
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRawEmail.htm.abstract: The email message, represented as a raw MIME message. The entire message must be base64 encoded.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRandomSplitE.name: nextActivity
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRandomSplitE.abstract: The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after completing the activity for the path.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRandomSplitE.name: percentage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRandomSplitE.abstract:
The percentage of participants to send down the activity path.

To determine which participants are sent down each path, Amazon Pinpoint applies a probability-based algorithm to the percentages that you specify for the paths. Therefore, the actual percentage of participants who are sent down a path may not be equal to the percentage that you specify.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRandomSplitA.name: branches
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRandomSplitA.abstract: The paths for the activity, including the percentage of participants to enter each path and the activity to perform for each path.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingQuietTime.ht.name: end
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingQuietTime.ht.abstract: The specific time when quiet time ends. This value has to use 24-hour notation and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a leading zero, if applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use 02:30 to represent 2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingQuietTime.ht.name: start
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingQuietTime.ht.abstract: The specific time when quiet time begins. This value has to use 24-hour notation and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a leading zero, if applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use 02:30 to represent 2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPutEventsRes.name: eventsResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPutEventsRes.abstract: Provides information about endpoints and the events that they’re associated with.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPutEventsReq.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPutEventsReq.abstract: The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPutEventsReq.name: eventsRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPutEventsReq.abstract: Specifies a batch of events to process.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPutEventStre.name: eventStream
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPutEventStre.abstract: Specifies settings for publishing event data to an Amazon Kinesis data stream or an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPutEventStre.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPutEventStre.abstract: The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPutEventStre.name: writeEventStream
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPutEventStre.abstract: Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an event stream to publish events to and the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role to use when publishing those events.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: ADM
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The message template that’s used for the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: APNS
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The message template that’s used for the APNs (Apple Push Notification service) channel. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: arn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: baidu
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The message template that’s used for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: defaultValue
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The default message template that’s used for push notification channels.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: defaultSubstitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for message variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: GCM
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The message template that’s used for the GCM channel, which is used to send notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: recommenderId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The unique identifier for the recommender model that’s used by the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: templateDescription
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The custom description of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: templateName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The name of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: templateType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For a push notification template, this value is PUSH.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the message template, or the version of the template that you specified by using the version parameter in your request.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: ADM
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The message template to use for the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: APNS
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The message template to use for the APNs (Apple Push Notification service) channel. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: baidu
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The message template to use for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: defaultValue
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The default message template to use for push notification channels.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: defaultSubstitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message that’s based on the template, you can override these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables and values.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: GCM
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The message template to use for the GCM channel, which is used to send notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message template overrides the default template for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: recommenderId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that use the template, if the template contains message variables for recommendation data.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: templateDescription
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: A custom description of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPushNotifica.abstract: A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.name: address
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.abstract: The unique identifier for the recipient, such as a device token, email address, or mobile phone number.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.name: attributes
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.abstract: One or more custom attributes that describe the endpoint by associating a name with an array of values. You can use these attributes as filter criteria when you create segments.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.name: channelType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.abstract: The channel that’s used when sending messages or push notifications to the endpoint.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.name: demographic
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.abstract: The demographic information for the endpoint, such as the time zone and platform.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.name: effectiveDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.abstract: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint was last updated.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.name: endpointStatus
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.abstract:
Specifies whether to send messages or push notifications to the endpoint. Valid values are: ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint; and, INACTIVE, messages arent sent to the endpoint.

Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.name: metrics
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.abstract: One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint for the endpoint.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.name: optOut
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.abstract: Specifies whether the user who’s associated with the endpoint has opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you. Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn’t want to receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn’t opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.name: requestId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.abstract: A unique identifier that’s generated each time the endpoint is updated.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.name: user
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPublicEndpoi.abstract: One or more custom user attributes that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint for the user who’s associated with the endpoint.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPhoneNumberV.name: numberValidateRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingPhoneNumberV.abstract: Specifies a phone number to validate and retrieve information about.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: carrier
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The carrier or service provider that the phone number is currently registered with. In some countries and regions, this value may be the carrier or service provider that the phone number was originally registered with.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: city
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The name of the city where the phone number was originally registered.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: cleansedPhoneNumberE164
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The cleansed phone number, in E.164 format, for the location where the phone number was originally registered.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: cleansedPhoneNumberNational
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The cleansed phone number, in the format for the location where the phone number was originally registered.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: country
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The name of the country or region where the phone number was originally registered.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: countryCodeIso2
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country or region where the phone number was originally registered.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: countryCodeNumeric
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The numeric code for the country or region where the phone number was originally registered.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: county
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The name of the county where the phone number was originally registered.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: originalCountryCodeIso2
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, that was sent in the request body.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: originalPhoneNumber
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The phone number that was sent in the request body.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: phoneType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The description of the phone type. Valid values are: MOBILE, LANDLINE, VOIP, INVALID, PREPAID, and OTHER.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: phoneTypeCode
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The phone type, represented by an integer. Valid values are: 0 (mobile), 1 (landline), 2 (VoIP), 3 (invalid), 4 (other), and 5 (prepaid).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: timezone
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The time zone for the location where the phone number was originally registered.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: zipCode
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The postal or ZIP code for the location where the phone number was originally registered.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: isoCountryCode
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country or region where the phone number was originally registered.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.name: phoneNumber
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingNumberValida.abstract: The phone number to retrieve information about. The phone number that you provide should include a valid numeric country code. Otherwise, the operation might result in an error.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMultiConditi.name: branches
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMultiConditi.abstract: The paths for the activity, including the conditions for entering each path and the activity to perform for each path.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMultiConditi.name: defaultActivity
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMultiConditi.abstract: The unique identifier for the activity to perform for participants who don’t meet any of the conditions specified for other paths in the activity.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMultiConditi.name: evaluationWaitTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMultiConditi.abstract: The amount of time to wait or the date and time when Amazon Pinpoint determines whether the conditions are met.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMultiConditi.name: condition
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMultiConditi.abstract: The condition to evaluate for the activity path.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMultiConditi.name: nextActivity
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMultiConditi.abstract: The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after completing the activity for the path.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMetricDimens.name: comparisonOperator
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMetricDimens.abstract: The operator to use when comparing metric values. Valid values are: GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL, and EQUAL.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageResul.name: deliveryStatus
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageResul.abstract:
The delivery status of the message. Possible values are:

  • DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won’t attempt to send the message again.

  • OPT_OUT - The user who’s associated with the endpoint address has opted out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won’t attempt to send the message again.

  • PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message to the endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won’t attempt to send the message again.

  • SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the endpoint address.

  • TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint won’t attempt to send the message again.

  • THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the message to the endpoint address.

  • TIMEOUT - The message couldn’t be sent within the timeout period.

  • UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageResul.name: messageId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageResul.abstract: The unique identifier for the message that was sent.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageResul.name: statusCode
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageResul.abstract: The downstream service status code for delivering the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageResul.name: statusMessage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageResul.abstract: The status message for delivering the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageResul.name: updatedToken
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageResul.abstract: For push notifications that are sent through the GCM channel, specifies whether the endpoint’s device registration token was updated as part of delivering the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageRespo.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageRespo.abstract: The unique identifier for the application that was used to send the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageRespo.name: endpointResult
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageRespo.abstract: A map that contains a multipart response for each address that the message was sent to. In the map, the endpoint ID is the key and the result is the value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageRespo.name: requestId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageRespo.abstract: The identifier for the original request that the message was delivered for.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageRespo.name: result
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageRespo.abstract: A map that contains a multipart response for each address (email address, phone number, or push notification token) that the message was sent to. In the map, the address is the key and the result is the value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageReque.name: addresses
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageReque.abstract: A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an address and each value is an AddressConfiguration object. An address can be a push notification token, a phone number, or an email address. You can use an AddressConfiguration object to tailor the message for an address by specifying settings such as content overrides and message variables.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageReque.name: context
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageReque.abstract: A map of custom attributes to attach to the message. For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageReque.name: endpoints
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageReque.abstract: A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an endpoint ID and each value is an EndpointSendConfiguration object. You can use an EndpointSendConfiguration object to tailor the message for an endpoint by specifying settings such as content overrides and message variables.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageReque.name: messageConfiguration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageReque.abstract: The settings and content for the default message and any default messages that you defined for specific channels.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageReque.name: templateConfiguration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageReque.abstract: The message template to use for the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageReque.name: traceId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageReque.abstract: The unique identifier for tracing the message. This identifier is visible to message recipients.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageConfi.name: ADMMessage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageConfi.abstract: The message that the campaign sends through the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel. This message overrides the default message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageConfi.name: APNSMessage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageConfi.abstract: The message that the campaign sends through the APNs (Apple Push Notification service) channel. This message overrides the default message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageConfi.name: baiduMessage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageConfi.abstract: The message that the campaign sends through the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel. This message overrides the default message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageConfi.name: defaultMessage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageConfi.abstract: The default message that the campaign sends through all the channels that are configured for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageConfi.name: emailMessage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageConfi.abstract: The message that the campaign sends through the email channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageConfi.name: GCMMessage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageConfi.abstract: The message that the campaign sends through the GCM channel, which enables Amazon Pinpoint to send push notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message overrides the default message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageConfi.name: SMSMessage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageConfi.abstract: The message that the campaign sends through the SMS channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageBody..name: message
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageBody..abstract: The message that’s returned from the API.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageBody..name: requestID
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessageBody..abstract: The unique identifier for the request or response.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.name: action
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.abstract:
The action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:

  • OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.

  • DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of iOS and Android.

  • URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient’s device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.name: body
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.abstract: The body of the notification message. The maximum number of characters is 200.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.name: imageIconUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.abstract: The URL of the image to display as the push-notification icon, such as the icon for the app.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.name: imageSmallIconUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.abstract: The URL of the image to display as the small, push-notification icon, such as a small version of the icon for the app.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.name: imageUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.abstract: The URL of an image to display in the push notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.name: jsonBody
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.abstract: The JSON payload to use for a silent push notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.name: mediaUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.abstract: The URL of the image or video to display in the push notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.name: rawContent
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.abstract: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.name: silentPush
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.abstract: Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification, which is a push notification that doesn’t display on a recipient’s device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app’s configuration, displaying messages in an in-app message center, or supporting phone home functionality.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.name: timeToLive
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.abstract:
The number of seconds that the push-notification service should keep the message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it’s sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service doesn’t store or try to deliver the notification again.

This value doesn’t apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon Device Messaging (ADM) service.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.name: title
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.abstract: The title to display above the notification message on a recipient’s device.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.name: url
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingMessage.html.abstract: The URL to open in a recipient’s default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.name: templatesResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.abstract: Provides information about all the message templates that are associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.abstract: Thestring that specifies which page of results to return in a paginated response. This parameter is currently not supported for application, campaign, and journey metrics.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.name: pageSize
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.abstract: The maximum number of items to include in each page of a paginated response. This parameter is currently not supported for application, campaign, and journey metrics.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.name: prefix
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.abstract: The substring to match in the names of the message templates to include in the results. If you specify this value, Amazon Pinpoint returns only those templates whose names begin with the value that you specify.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.name: templateType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.abstract: The type of message template to include in the results. Valid values are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE. To include all types of templates in the results, don’t include this parameter in your request.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.name: templateVersionsResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.abstract: Provides information about all the versions of a specific message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.abstract: Thestring that specifies which page of results to return in a paginated response. This parameter is currently not supported for application, campaign, and journey metrics.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.name: pageSize
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.abstract: The maximum number of items to include in each page of a paginated response. This parameter is currently not supported for application, campaign, and journey metrics.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.name: templateName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.abstract: The name of the message template. A template name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.name: templateType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTemplate.abstract: The type of channel that the message template is designed for. Valid values are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTagsForR.name: tagsModel
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTagsForR.abstract: Specifies the tags (keys and values) for an application, campaign, message template, or segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTagsForR.name: resourceArn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListTagsForR.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListRecommen.name: item
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListRecommen.abstract: An array of responses, one for each recommender model configuration that’s associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListRecommen.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListRecommen.abstract: The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListJourneys.name: journeysResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListJourneys.abstract: Provides information about the status, configuration, and other settings for all the journeys that are associated with an application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListJourneys.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListJourneys.abstract: The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListJourneys.name: pageSize
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListJourneys.abstract: The maximum number of items to include in each page of a paginated response. This parameter is currently not supported for application, campaign, and journey metrics.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListJourneys.name: token
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingListJourneys.abstract: The NextToken string that specifies which page of results to return in a paginated response.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneysResp.name: item
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneysResp.abstract: An array of responses, one for each journey that’s associated with the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneysResp.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneysResp.abstract: The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyState.name: state
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyState.abstract:
The status of the journey. Currently, the only supported value is CANCELLED.

If you cancel a journey, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are complete. Amazon Pinpoint also continues to collect and aggregate analytics data for those activities, until they are complete, and any activities that were complete when you cancelled the journey.

After you cancel a journey, you can’t add, change, or remove any activities from the journey. In addition, Amazon Pinpoint stops evaluating the journey and doesn’t perform any activities that haven’t started.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneySched.name: endTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneySched.abstract: The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey ended or will end.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneySched.name: startTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneySched.abstract: The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey began or will begin.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneySched.name: timezone
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneySched.abstract: The starting UTC offset for the journey schedule, if the value of the journey’s LocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01, UTC+02, UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45, UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+08:45, UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10, UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+12:45, UTC+13, UTC+13:45, UTC-02, UTC-02:30, UTC-03, UTC-03:30, UTC-04, UTC-05, UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-09:30, UTC-10, and UTC-11.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.name: activities
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.abstract: A map that contains a set of Activity objects, one object for each activity in the journey. For each Activity object, the key is the unique identifier (string) for an activity and the value is the settings for the activity.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.abstract: The unique identifier for the application that the journey applies to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was created.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.name: limits
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.abstract: The messaging and entry limits for the journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.name: localTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.abstract: Specifies whether the journey’s scheduled start and end times use each participant’s local time. If this value is true, the schedule uses each participant’s local time.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.name: quietTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.abstract:
The quiet time settings for the journey. Quiet time is a specific time range when a journey doesn’t send messages to participants, if all the following conditions are met:

  • The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint for the participant is set to a valid value.

  • The current time in the participant’s time zone is later than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the journey.

  • The current time in the participant’s time zone is earlier than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the journey.

If any of the preceding conditions isn’t met, the participant will receive messages from the journey, even if quiet time is enabled.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.name: refreshFrequency
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.abstract: The frequency with which Amazon Pinpoint evaluates segment and event data for the journey, as a duration in ISO 8601 format.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.name: startActivity
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.abstract: The unique identifier for the first activity in the journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.name: startCondition
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.abstract: The segment that defines which users are participants in the journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.name: state
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.abstract:
The current status of the journey. Possible values are:

  • DRAFT - The journey is being developed and hasn’t been published yet.

  • ACTIVE - The journey has been developed and published. Depending on the journey’s schedule, the journey may currently be running or scheduled to start running at a later time. If a journey’s status is ACTIVE, you can’t add, change, or remove activities from it.

  • COMPLETED - The journey has been published and has finished running. All participants have entered the journey and no participants are waiting to complete the journey or any activities in the journey.

  • CANCELLED - The journey has been stopped. If a journey’s status is CANCELLED, you can’t add, change, or remove activities or segment settings from the journey.

  • CLOSED - The journey has been published and has started running. It may have also passed its scheduled end time, or passed its scheduled start time and a refresh frequency hasn’t been specified for it. If a journey’s status is CLOSED, you can’t add participants to it, and no existing participants can enter the journey for the first time. However, any existing participants who are currently waiting to start an activity may continue the journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyRespo.abstract: This object is not used or supported.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyLimit.name: dailyCap
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyLimit.abstract: The maximum number of messages that the journey can send to a single participant during a 24-hour period. The maximum value is 100.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyLimit.name: endpointReentryCap
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyLimit.abstract: The maximum number of times that a participant can enter the journey. The maximum value is 100. To allow participants to enter the journey an unlimited number of times, set this value to 0.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyLimit.name: messagesPerSecond
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyLimit.abstract: The maximum number of messages that the journey can send each second.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyExecu.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyExecu.abstract: The unique identifier for the application that the metric applies to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyExecu.name: journeyId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyExecu.abstract: The unique identifier for the journey that the metric applies to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyExecu.name: lastEvaluatedTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyExecu.abstract: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Pinpoint last evaluated the journey and updated the data for the metric.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyExecu.name: metrics
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyExecu.abstract: A JSON object that contains the results of the query. For information about the structure and contents of the results, see the Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyExecu.name: activityType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingJourneyExecu.abstract:
The type of activity that the metric applies to. Possible values are:

  • CONDITIONAL_SPLIT - For a yes/no split activity, which is an activity that sends participants down one of two paths in a journey.

  • HOLDOUT - For a holdout activity, which is an activity that stops a journey for a specified percentage of participants.

  • MESSAGE - For an email activity, which is an activity that sends an email message to participants.

  • MULTI_CONDITIONAL_SPLIT - For a multivariate split activity, which is an activity that sends participants down one of as many as five paths in a journey.

  • RANDOM_SPLIT - For a random split activity, which is an activity that sends specified percentages of participants down one of as many as five paths in a journey.

  • WAIT - For a wait activity, which is an activity that waits for a certain amount of time or until a specific date and time before moving participants to the next activity in a journey.

If the files are stored in an Amazon S3 location and that location contains multiple files that use different formats, Amazon Pinpoint imports data only from the files that use the specified format.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingImportJobRes.name: s3Url
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingImportJobRes.abstract:
The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that contains the endpoint definitions to import. This location can be a folder or a single file. If the location is a folder, Amazon Pinpoint imports endpoint definitions from the files in this location, including any subfolders that the folder contains.

The URL should be in the following format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/file-name. The location can end with the key for an individual object or a prefix that qualifies multiple objects.

To determine which participants are held out, Amazon Pinpoint applies a probability-based algorithm to the percentage that you specify. Therefore, the actual percentage of participants who are held out may not be equal to the percentage that you specify.

The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGetVoiceTemp.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGetVoiceTemp.abstract:
The unique identifier for the version of the message template to update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers and other information for all the versions of a template, use the Template Versions resource.

If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. If specified for an update operation, this value must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don’t occur.

If you don’t specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does the following:

  • For a get operation, retrieves information about the active version of the template.

  • For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version parameter isn’t used or is set to false.

  • For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all versions of the template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGetEmailTemp.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGetEmailTemp.abstract:
The unique identifier for the version of the message template to update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers and other information for all the versions of a template, use the Template Versions resource.

If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. If specified for an update operation, this value must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don’t occur.

If you don’t specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does the following:

  • For a get operation, retrieves information about the active version of the template.

  • For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version parameter isn’t used or is set to false.

  • For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all versions of the template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: action
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract:
The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:

  • OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.

  • DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of the Android platform.

  • URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient’s device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: collapseKey
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract:
An arbitrary string that identifies a group of messages that can be collapsed to ensure that only the last message is sent when delivery can resume. This helps avoid sending too many instances of the same messages when the recipient’s device comes online again or becomes active.

Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) collapse_key parameter when it sends the notification message to FCM.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: data
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract: The JSON data payload to use for the push notification, if the notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: iconReference
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract: The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: imageIconUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract: The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the push notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: imageUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract: The URL of an image to display in the push notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: priority
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract:
para>normal - The notification might be delayed. Delivery is optimized for battery usage on the recipient’s device. Use this value unless immediate delivery is required.

/listitem>

  • high - The notification is sent immediately and might wake a sleeping device.

    • /para>

    Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the FCM priority parameter when it sends the notification message to FCM.

    The equivalent values for Apple Push Notification service (APNs) are 5, for normal, and 10, for high. If you specify an APNs value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint accepts and converts the value to the corresponding FCM value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: rawContent
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: restrictedPackageName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract: The package name of the application where registration tokens must match in order for the recipient to receive the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: silentPush
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract: Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification, which is a push notification that doesn’t display on a recipient’s device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app’s configuration or supporting phone home functionality.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: smallImageIconUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract: The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the content view of the push notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: sound
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract: The sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that’s bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: substitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract: The default message variables to use in the notification message. You can override the default variables with individual address variables.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: timeToLive
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract:
The amount of time, in seconds, that FCM should store and attempt to deliver the push notification, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the first time. If you don’t specify this value, FCM defaults to the maximum value, which is 2,419,200 seconds (28 days).

Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the FCM time_to_live parameter when it sends the notification message to FCM.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: title
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract: The title to display above the notification message on the recipient’s device.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.name: url
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMMessage.h.abstract: The URL to open in the recipient’s default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMChannelRe.name: applicationId

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMChannelRe.name: creationDate

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMChannelRe.name: credential

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMChannelRe.abstract: (Deprecated) An identifier for the GCM channel. This property is retained only for backward compatibility.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMChannelRe.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMChannelRe.abstract: The date and time when the GCM channel was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMChannelRe.name: platform
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMChannelRe.abstract: The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For the GCM channel, this value is GCM.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMChannelRe.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMChannelRe.abstract: The current version of the GCM channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMChannelRe.name: apiKey
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMChannelRe.abstract: The Web API Key, also referred to as an API_KEY or server key, that you received from Google to communicate with Google services.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMChannelRe.name: enabled
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingGCMChannelRe.abstract: Specifies whether to enable the GCM channel for the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobsRe.abstract: An array of responses, one for each export job that’s associated with the application (Export Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Export Jobs resource).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.name: jobStatus
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.abstract: The status of the export job. The job status is FAILED if Amazon Pinpoint wasn’t able to process one or more pieces in the job.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.name: totalFailures

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.name: totalPieces
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.abstract: The total number of pieces that must be processed to complete the export job. Each piece consists of an approximately equal portion of the endpoint definitions that are part of the export job.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.name: totalProcessed

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.name: types
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.abstract: The job type. This value is EXPORT for export jobs.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.name: roleArn
