Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.name: s3UrlPrefix
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.abstract: The URL of the location in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket where the endpoint definitions were exported to. This location is typically a folder that contains multiple files. The URL should be in the following format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.name: segmentId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.abstract: The identifier for the segment that the endpoint definitions were exported from. If this value isn’t present, Amazon Pinpoint exported definitions for all the endpoints that are associated with the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.name: segmentVersion
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobRes.abstract: The version of the segment that the endpoint definitions were exported from.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobReq.name: roleArn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobReq.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to access the Amazon S3 location where you want to export endpoint definitions to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobReq.name: s3UrlPrefix
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobReq.abstract: The URL of the location in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket where you want to export endpoint definitions to. This location is typically a folder that contains multiple files. The URL should be in the following format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobReq.name: segmentId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobReq.abstract: The identifier for the segment to export endpoint definitions from. If you don’t specify this value, Amazon Pinpoint exports definitions for all the endpoints that are associated with the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingExportJobReq.abstract: The version of the segment to export endpoint definitions from, if specified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventsRespon.name: results
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventsRespon.abstract: A map that contains a multipart response for each endpoint. For each item in this object, the endpoint ID is the key and the item response is the value. If no item response exists, the value can also be one of the following: 202, the request was processed successfully; or 400, the payload wasn’t valid or required fields were missing.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventsReques.name: batchItem
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventsReques.abstract: The batch of events to process. For each item in a batch, the endpoint ID acts as a key that has an EventsBatch object as its value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventsBatch..name: endpoint
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventsBatch..abstract: A set of properties and attributes that are associated with the endpoint.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventsBatch..name: events

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventStream..name: destinationStreamArn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventStream..abstract:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis data stream or Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream to publish event data to.

For a Kinesis data stream, the ARN format is: arn:aws:kinesis:region:account-id:stream/stream_name

For a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the ARN format is: arn:aws:firehose:region:account-id:deliverystream/stream_name

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventStream..name: externalId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventStream..abstract: (Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value to assume an IAM role when publishing event data, but we removed this requirement. We don’t recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventStream..name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventStream..abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the event stream was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventStream..name: lastUpdatedBy
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventStream..abstract: The IAM user who last modified the event stream.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventStream..name: roleArn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventStream..abstract: The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to publish event data to the stream in your AWS account.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventItemRes.name: message
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventItemRes.abstract: A custom message that’s returned in the response as a result of processing the event.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventItemRes.name: statusCode
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventItemRes.abstract: The status code that’s returned in the response as a result of processing the event. Possible values are: 202, for events that were accepted; and, 400, for events that weren’t valid.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventDimensi.name: attributes
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventDimensi.abstract: One or more custom attributes that your application reports to Amazon Pinpoint. You can use these attributes as selection criteria when you create an event filter.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventDimensi.name: eventType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventDimensi.abstract: The name of the event that causes the campaign to be sent or the journey activity to be performed. This can be a standard event that Amazon Pinpoint generates, such as _email.delivered. For campaigns, this can also be a custom event that’s specific to your application. For information about standard events, see Streaming Amazon Pinpoint Events in the Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventDimensi.name: metrics
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventDimensi.abstract: One or more custom metrics that your application reports to Amazon Pinpoint. You can use these metrics as selection criteria when you create an event filter.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventConditi.name: dimensions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventConditi.abstract: The dimensions for the event filter to use for the activity.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventConditi.name: messageActivity
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEventConditi.abstract: The message identifier (message_id) for the message to use when determining whether message events meet the condition.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEvent.html#/.name: appTitle

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEvent.html#/.name: appVersionCode

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEvent.html#/.name: timestamp

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointsRes.name: item
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointsRes.abstract: An array of responses, one for each endpoint that’s associated with the user ID.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointUser.name: userAttributes
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointUser.abstract:
One or more custom attributes that describe the user by associating a name with an array of values. For example, the value of an attribute named Interests might be: [“Science”, “Music”, “Travel”]. You can use these attributes as filter criteria when you create segments. Attribute names are case sensitive.

An attribute name can contain up to 50 characters. An attribute value can contain up to 100 characters. When you define the name of a custom attribute, avoid using the following characters: number sign (#), colon (:), question mark (?), backslash (\), and slash (/). The Amazon Pinpoint console can’t display attribute names that contain these characters. This restriction doesn’t apply to attribute values.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointSend.name: bodyOverride
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointSend.abstract: The body of the message. If specified, this value overrides the default message body.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointSend.name: context
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointSend.abstract:
A map of custom attributes to attach to the message for the address. Attribute names are case sensitive.

For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointSend.name: rawContent
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointSend.abstract: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the message. If specified, this value overrides all other values for the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointSend.name: substitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointSend.abstract: A map of the message variables to merge with the variables specified for the default message (DefaultMessage.Substitutions). The variables specified in this map take precedence over all other variables.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointSend.name: titleOverride
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointSend.abstract: The title or subject line of the message. If specified, this value overrides the default message title or subject line.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.name: address
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.abstract: The destination address for messages or push notifications that you send to the endpoint. The address varies by channel. For example, the address for a push-notification channel is typically the token provided by a push notification service, such as an Apple Push Notification service (APNs) device token or a Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) registration token. The address for the SMS channel is a phone number in E.164 format, such as +12065550100. The address for the email channel is an email address.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.abstract: The unique identifier for the application that’s associated with the endpoint.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.name: attributes
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.abstract: One or more custom attributes that describe the endpoint by associating a name with an array of values. For example, the value of a custom attribute named Interests might be: [“Science”, “Music”, “Travel”]. You can use these attributes as filter criteria when you create segments.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.name: channelType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.abstract: The channel that’s used when sending messages or push notifications to the endpoint.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.name: cohortId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.abstract: A number from 0-99 that represents the cohort that the endpoint is assigned to. Endpoints are grouped into cohorts randomly, and each cohort contains approximately 1 percent of the endpoints for an application. Amazon Pinpoint assigns cohorts to the holdout or treatment allocations for campaigns.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.abstract: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint was created.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.name: demographic
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.abstract: The demographic information for the endpoint, such as the time zone and platform.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.name: effectiveDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.abstract: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint was last updated.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.name: endpointStatus
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.abstract:
Specifies whether messages or push notifications are sent to the endpoint. Possible values are: ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint; and, INACTIVE, messages arent sent to the endpoint.

Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.name: identifier
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.abstract: The unique identifier that you assigned to the endpoint. The identifier should be a globally unique identifier (GUID) to ensure that it doesn’t conflict with other endpoint identifiers that are associated with the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.name: metrics
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.abstract: One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint for the endpoint.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.name: optOut
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.abstract: Specifies whether the user who’s associated with the endpoint has opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you. Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn’t want to receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn’t opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.name: requestId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.abstract: The unique identifier for the most recent request to update the endpoint.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointResp.name: user

For the SMS channel, use a phone number in E.164 format, such as +12065550100. For the email channel, use an email address.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointMess.name: address
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointMess.abstract: The endpoint address that the message was delivered to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointMess.name: deliveryStatus
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointMess.abstract:
The delivery status of the message. Possible values are:

  • DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won’t attempt to send the message again.

  • OPT_OUT - The user who’s associated with the endpoint has opted out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won’t attempt to send the message again.

  • PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message to the endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint won’t attempt to send the message again.

  • SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the endpoint.

  • TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint won’t attempt to send the message again.

  • THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the message to the endpoint.

  • TIMEOUT - The message couldn’t be sent within the timeout period.

  • UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointMess.name: messageId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointMess.abstract: The unique identifier for the message that was sent.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointMess.name: statusCode
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointMess.abstract: The downstream service status code for delivering the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointMess.name: statusMessage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointMess.abstract: The status message for delivering the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointMess.name: updatedToken

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointLoca.name: longitude
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointLoca.abstract: The longitude coordinate of the endpoint location, rounded to one decimal place.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointLoca.name: postalCode

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointLoca.name: region

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointItem.abstract: The custom message that’s returned in the response as a result of processing the endpoint data.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEndpointItem.name: statusCode

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: arn

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: defaultSubstitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for message variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: htmlPart
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: The message body, in HTML format, that’s used in email messages that are based on the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: recommenderId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: The unique identifier for the recommender model that’s used by the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: subject
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: The subject line, or title, that’s used in email messages that are based on the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: templateDescription
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: The custom description of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: templateName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: The name of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: templateType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For an email template, this value is EMAIL.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: textPart
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: The message body, in plain text format, that’s used in email messages that are based on the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the message template, or the version of the template that you specified by using the version parameter in your request.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: defaultSubstitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message that’s based on the template, you can override these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables and values.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: htmlPart
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: The message body, in HTML format, to use in email messages that are based on the message template. We recommend using HTML format for email clients that render HTML content. You can include links, formatted text, and more in an HTML message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: recommenderId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that use the template, if the template contains message variables for recommendation data.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: subject
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: The subject line, or title, to use in email messages that are based on the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: templateDescription
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: A custom description of the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailTemplat.abstract: A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailMessage.name: nextActivity

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailMessage.name: templateVersion
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailMessage.abstract:
The unique identifier for the version of the email template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.

If you don’t specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses the active version of the template. The active version is typically the version of a template that’s been most recently reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn’t necessarily the latest version of a template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingEmailMessage.name: feedbackForwardingAddress

The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDeleteVoiceT.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDeleteVoiceT.abstract:
The unique identifier for the version of the message template to update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers and other information for all the versions of a template, use the Template Versions resource.

If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. If specified for an update operation, this value must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don’t occur.

If you don’t specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does the following:

  • For a get operation, retrieves information about the active version of the template.

  • For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version parameter isn’t used or is set to false.

  • For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all versions of the template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.name: action
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.abstract:
The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that’s based on the message template. Valid values are:

  • OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.

  • DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of the iOS and Android platforms.

  • URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient’s device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.name: body
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.abstract: The message body to use in push notifications that are based on the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.name: sound
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.abstract:
The sound to play when a recipient receives a push notification that’s based on the message template. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that’s bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.

For an iOS platform, this value is the key for the name of a sound file in your app’s main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your app’s data container. If the sound file can’t be found or you specify default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.name: title
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.abstract: The title to use in push notifications that are based on the message template. This title appears above the notification message on a recipient’s device.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.name: url
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.abstract: The URL to open in a recipient’s default mobile browser, if a recipient taps a push notification that’s based on the message template and the value of the Action property is URL.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.name: action
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.abstract:
The default action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:

  • OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.

  • DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of the iOS and Android platforms.

  • URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient’s device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.name: body
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.abstract: The default body of the notification message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.name: data
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.abstract: The JSON data payload to use for the default push notification, if the notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.name: silentPush
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.abstract: Specifies whether the default notification is a silent push notification, which is a push notification that doesn’t display on a recipient’s device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app’s configuration or delivering messages to an in-app notification center.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.name: substitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.abstract: The default message variables to use in the notification message. You can override the default variables with individual address variables.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.name: title
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.abstract: The default title to display above the notification message on a recipient’s device.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.name: url
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultPushN.abstract: The default URL to open in a recipient’s default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultMessa.name: substitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingDefaultMessa.abstract: The default message variables to use in the message. You can override these default variables with individual address variables.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.name: recommenderConfigurationResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.abstract: Provides information about Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for retrieving and processing data from a recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.name: createRecommenderConfiguration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.abstract: Specifies Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for retrieving and processing recommendation data from a recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.name: attributes
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.abstract:
A map of key-value pairs that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending on the value for the RecommenderUserIdType property. Each of these attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that’s retrieved from the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda function for additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a message variable in a message template.

In the map, the key is the name of a custom attribute and the value is a custom display name for that attribute. The display name appears in the Attribute finder pane of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The following restrictions apply to these names:

  • An attribute name must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 50 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Attribute names are case sensitive and must be unique.

  • An attribute display name must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).

This object is required if the configuration invokes an AWS Lambda function (LambdaFunctionArn) to process recommendation data. Otherwise, don’t include this object in your request.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.name: detail
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.abstract: A custom description of the configuration for the recommender model. The description can contain up to 128 characters.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.name: name
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.abstract: A custom name of the configuration for the recommender model. The name must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.name: recommendationProviderIdType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.abstract:
The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID to associate with unique user IDs in the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute and event data thats specific to a particular endpoint or user in an Amazon Pinpoint application. Valid values are:

  • PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Associate each user in the model with a particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.

  • PINPOINT_USER_ID - Associate each user in the model with a particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If you specify this value, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify a both a user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages wont be sent to the user’s endpoint.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.name: recommendationProviderRoleArn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve recommendation data from the recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.name: recommendationProviderUri
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model to retrieve recommendation data from. This value must match the ARN of an Amazon Personalize campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.name: recommendationTransformerUri
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.abstract: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that’s retrieved from the recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.name: recommendationsDisplayName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.abstract:
A custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores a recommended item for each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the RecommenderUserIdType property. This value is required if the configuration doesn’t invoke an AWS Lambda function (LambdaFunctionArn) to perform additional processing of recommendation data.

This name appears in the Attribute finder pane of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The name can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). These restrictions don’t apply to attribute values.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.name: recommendationsPerMessage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateRecomm.abstract:
The number of recommended items to retrieve from the model for each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the RecommenderUserIdType property. This number determines how many recommended attributes are available for use as message variables in message templates. The minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 5. The default value is 5.

To use multiple recommended items and custom attributes with message variables, you have to use an AWS Lambda function (LambdaFunctionArn) to perform additional processing of recommendation data.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreatePushTe.name: createTemplateMessageBody
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreatePushTe.abstract: Provides information about a request to create a message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreatePushTe.name: pushNotificationTemplateRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreatePushTe.abstract: Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be used in messages that are sent through a push notification channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreatePushTe.name: templateName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreatePushTe.abstract: The name of the message template. A template name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateJourne.name: journeyResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateJourne.abstract: Provides information about the status, configuration, and other settings for a journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateJourne.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateJourne.abstract: The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateJourne.name: writeJourneyRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateJourne.abstract: Specifies the configuration and other settings for a journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateImport.name: importJobResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateImport.abstract: Provides information about the status and settings of a job that imports endpoint definitions from one or more files. The files can be stored in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket or uploaded directly from a computer by using the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateImport.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateImport.abstract: The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateImport.name: importJobRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateImport.abstract: Specifies the settings for a job that imports endpoint definitions from an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateExport.name: exportJobResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateExport.abstract: Provides information about the status and settings of a job that exports endpoint definitions to a file. The file can be added directly to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket by using the Amazon Pinpoint API or downloaded directly to a computer by using the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateExport.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateExport.abstract: The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateExport.name: exportJobRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateExport.abstract: Specifies the settings for a job that exports endpoint definitions to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateEmailT.name: createTemplateMessageBody
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateEmailT.abstract: Provides information about a request to create a message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateEmailT.name: emailTemplateRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateEmailT.abstract: Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be used in messages that are sent through the email channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateEmailT.name: templateName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateEmailT.abstract: The name of the message template. A template name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateCampai.name: campaignResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateCampai.abstract: Provides information about the status, configuration, and other settings for a campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateCampai.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateCampai.abstract: The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateCampai.name: writeCampaignRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateCampai.abstract: Specifies the configuration and other settings for a campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateApplic.name: name
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateApplic.abstract: The display name of the application. This name is displayed as the Project name on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateApplic.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateApplic.abstract: A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the application. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateAppReq.name: createApplicationRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCreateAppReq.abstract: Specifies the display name of an application and the tags to associate with the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingConditionalS.name: condition
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingConditionalS.abstract: The conditions that define the paths for the activity, and the relationship between the conditions.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingConditionalS.name: evaluationWaitTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingConditionalS.abstract: The amount of time to wait before determining whether the conditions are met, or the date and time when Amazon Pinpoint determines whether the conditions are met.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingConditionalS.name: falseActivity
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingConditionalS.abstract: The unique identifier for the activity to perform if the conditions aren’t met.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingConditionalS.name: trueActivity
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingConditionalS.abstract: The unique identifier for the activity to perform if the conditions are met.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCondition.ht.name: conditions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCondition.ht.abstract: The conditions to evaluate for the activity.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCondition.ht.name: operator
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCondition.ht.abstract: Specifies how to handle multiple conditions for the activity. For example, if you specify two conditions for an activity, whether both or only one of the conditions must be met for the activity to be performed.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingChannelsResp.name: channels
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingChannelsResp.abstract: A map that contains a multipart response for each channel. For each item in this object, the ChannelType is the key and the Channel is the value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingChannelRespo.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingChannelRespo.abstract: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the channel was enabled.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingChannelRespo.name: enabled
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingChannelRespo.abstract: Specifies whether the channel is enabled for the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingChannelRespo.name: hasCredential
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingChannelRespo.abstract: (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingChannelRespo.name: identifier
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingChannelRespo.abstract: (Deprecated) An identifier for the channel. This property is retained only for backward compatibility.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingChannelRespo.name: lastModifiedBy
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingChannelRespo.abstract: The user who last modified the channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingChannelRespo.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingChannelRespo.abstract: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the channel was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignsRes.name: item
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignsRes.abstract: An array of responses, one for each campaign that’s associated with the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignsRes.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignsRes.abstract: The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignStat.name: campaignStatus
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignStat.abstract: The current status of the campaign, or the current status of a treatment that belongs to an A/B test campaign. If a campaign uses A/B testing, the campaign has a status of COMPLETED only if all campaign treatments have a status of COMPLETED.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignSmsM.name: messageType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignSmsM.abstract: The type of SMS message. Valid values are: TRANSACTIONAL, the message is critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time password that supports a customer transaction; and, PROMOTIONAL, the message isn’t critical or time-sensitive, such as a marketing message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignSmsM.name: senderId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignSmsM.abstract: The sender ID to display on recipients’ devices when they receive the SMS message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: additionalTreatments
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: An array of responses, one for each treatment that you defined for the campaign, in addition to the default treatment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The unique identifier for the application that the campaign applies to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: arn
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign was created.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: defaultState
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The current status of the campaign’s default treatment. This value exists only for campaigns that have more than one treatment, to support A/B testing.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: detail
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The custom description of the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: holdoutPercent
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The allocated percentage of users (segment members) who shouldn’t receive messages from the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: hook
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The settings for the AWS Lambda function to use as a code hook for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: identifier
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The unique identifier for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: isPaused
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: Specifies whether the campaign is paused. A paused campaign doesn’t run unless you resume it by changing this value to false.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: limits
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The messaging limits for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: messageConfiguration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The message configuration settings for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: name
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The name of the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: schedule
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The schedule settings for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: segmentId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The unique identifier for the segment that’s associated with the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: segmentVersion
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The version number of the segment that’s associated with the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: state
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The current status of the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: templateConfiguration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The message template thats used for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: treatmentDescription
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The custom description of a variation of the campaign that’s used for A/B testing.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: treatmentName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The custom name of a variation of the campaign that’s used for A/B testing.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: The version number of the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.name: tags
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignResp.abstract: A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated with the campaign. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignLimi.name: daily
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignLimi.abstract: The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single endpoint during a 24-hour period. The maximum value is 100.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignLimi.name: maximumDuration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignLimi.abstract: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that a campaign can attempt to deliver a message after the scheduled start time for the campaign. The minimum value is 60 seconds.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignLimi.name: messagesPerSecond
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignLimi.abstract: The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send each second. The minimum value is 50. The maximum value is 20,000.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignLimi.name: total
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignLimi.abstract: The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single endpoint during the course of the campaign. The maximum value is 100.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignHook.name: lambdaFunctionName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignHook.abstract: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that Amazon Pinpoint invokes to send messages for a campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignHook.name: mode
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignHook.abstract: Specifies which Lambda mode to use when invoking the AWS Lambda function.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignHook.name: webUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignHook.abstract: The web URL that Amazon Pinpoint calls to invoke the AWS Lambda function over HTTPS.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignEven.name: dimensions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignEven.abstract: The dimension settings of the event filter for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignEven.name: filterType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignEven.abstract: The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent. Valid values are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign when a system event occurs; and, ENDPOINT, sends the campaign when an endpoint event (Events resource) occurs.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignEmai.name: body
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignEmai.abstract: The body of the email for recipients whose email clients don’t render HTML content.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignEmai.name: fromAddress
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignEmai.abstract: The verified email address to send the email from. The default address is the FromAddress specified for the email channel for the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignEmai.name: htmlBody
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignEmai.abstract: The body of the email, in HTML format, for recipients whose email clients render HTML content.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignEmai.name: title
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignEmai.abstract: The subject line, or title, of the email.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignDate.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignDate.abstract: The unique identifier for the application that the metric applies to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignDate.name: campaignId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignDate.abstract: The unique identifier for the campaign that the metric applies to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignDate.name: endTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignDate.abstract: The last date and time of the date range that was used to filter the query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is inclusive.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignDate.name: kpiName
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignDate.abstract: The name of the metric, also referred to as a key performance indicator (KPI), that the data was retrieved for. This value describes the associated metric and consists of two or more terms, which are comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by a hyphen. For a list of possible values, see the Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignDate.name: kpiResult
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignDate.abstract: An array of objects that contains the results of the query. Each object contains the value for the metric and metadata about that value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignDate.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignDate.abstract: The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null for the Campaign Metrics resource because the resource returns all results in a single page.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignDate.name: startTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingCampaignDate.abstract: The first date and time of the date range that was used to filter the query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is inclusive.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaseKpiResul.name: rows
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaseKpiResul.abstract: An array of objects that provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.name: action
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.abstract:
The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:

  • OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.

  • DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of the Android platform.

  • URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient’s device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.name: data
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.abstract: The JSON data payload to use for the push notification, if the notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.name: iconReference
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.abstract: The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.name: imageIconUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.abstract: The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the push notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.name: imageUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.abstract: The URL of an image to display in the push notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.name: rawContent
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.abstract: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.name: silentPush
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.abstract: Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification, which is a push notification that doesn’t display on a recipient’s device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app’s configuration or supporting phone home functionality.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.name: smallImageIconUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.abstract: The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the content view of the push notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.name: sound
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.abstract: The sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that’s bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.name: substitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.abstract: The default message variables to use in the notification message. You can override the default variables with individual address variables.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.name: timeToLive
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.abstract: The amount of time, in seconds, that the Baidu Cloud Push service should store the message if the recipient’s device is offline. The default value and maximum supported time is 604,800 seconds (7 days).

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.name: title
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.abstract: The title to display above the notification message on the recipient’s device.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.name: url
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduMessage.abstract: The URL to open in the recipient’s default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.abstract: The unique identifier for the application that the Baidu channel applies to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.name: creationDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.abstract: The date and time when the Baidu channel was enabled.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.name: credential
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.abstract: The API key that you received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to communicate with the service.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.name: enabled
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.abstract: Specifies whether the Baidu channel is enabled for the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.name: hasCredential
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.abstract: (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.name: identifier
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.abstract: (Deprecated) An identifier for the Baidu channel. This property is retained only for backward compatibility.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.name: isArchived
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.abstract: Specifies whether the Baidu channel is archived.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.name: lastModifiedBy
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.abstract: The user who last modified the Baidu channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.abstract: The date and time when the Baidu channel was last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.name: platform
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.abstract: The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For the Baidu channel, this value is BAIDU.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.name: version
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.abstract: The current version of the Baidu channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.name: apiKey
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.abstract: The API key that you received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to communicate with the service.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.name: enabled
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.abstract: Specifies whether to enable the Baidu channel for the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.name: secretKey
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingBaiduChannel.abstract: The secret key that you received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to communicate with the service.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAttributesRe.name: attributeType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAttributesRe.abstract:
The type of attribute or attributes that were removed from the endpoints. Valid values are:

  • endpoint-custom-attributes - Custom attributes that describe endpoints.

  • endpoint-metric-attributes - Custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint for endpoints.

  • endpoint-user-attributes - Custom attributes that describe users.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAttributesRe.name: attributes
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAttributesRe.abstract: An array that specifies the names of the attributes that were removed from the endpoints.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAttributeDim.name: attributeType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAttributeDim.abstract: The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are: INCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the criteria are included in the segment; and, EXCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the criteria are excluded from the segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAttributeDim.name: values
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAttributeDim.abstract: The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the value of the AttributeType property, endpoints are included or excluded from the segment if their attribute values match the criteria values.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplications.name: item
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplications.abstract: An array of responses, one for each application that was returned.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplications.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplications.abstract: The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplicationS.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplicationS.abstract: The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplicationS.name: campaignHook
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplicationS.abstract: The settings for the AWS Lambda function to use by default as a code hook for campaigns in the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplicationS.name: lastModifiedDate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplicationS.abstract: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the application’s settings were last modified.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplicationS.name: limits
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplicationS.abstract: The default sending limits for campaigns in the application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplicationS.name: quietTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplicationS.abstract:
The default quiet time for campaigns and journeys in the application. Quiet time is a specific time range when messages aren’t sent to endpoints, if all the following conditions are met:

  • The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set to a valid value.

  • The current time in the endpoint’s time zone is later than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time settings).

  • The current time in the endpoint’s time zone is earlier than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time settings).

If any of the preceding conditions isn’t met, the endpoint will receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is enabled.

This value describes the associated metric and consists of two or more terms, which are comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by a hyphen. For a list of possible values, see the Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplicationD.name: kpiResult
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplicationD.abstract: An array of objects that contains the results of the query. Each object contains the value for the metric and metadata about that value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplicationD.name: startTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingApplicationD.abstract: The first date and time of the date range that was used to filter the query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is inclusive.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.name: action
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.abstract:
The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that’s based on the message template. Valid values are:

  • OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.

  • DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of the Android platform.

  • URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient’s device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.name: body
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.abstract: The message body to use in a push notification that’s based on the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.name: imageIconUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.abstract: The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of a push notification that’s based on the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.name: imageUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.abstract: The URL of an image to display in a push notification that’s based on the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.name: rawContent
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.abstract: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for a push notification that’s based on the message template. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.name: smallImageIconUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.abstract: The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the content view of a push notification that’s based on the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.name: sound
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.abstract: The sound to play when a recipient receives a push notification that’s based on the message template. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that’s bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.name: title
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.abstract: The title to use in a push notification that’s based on the message template. This title appears above the notification message on a recipient’s device.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.name: url
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAndroidPushN.abstract: The URL to open in a recipient’s default mobile browser, if a recipient taps a push notification that’s based on the message template and the value of the Action property is URL.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAddressConfi.name: bodyOverride
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAddressConfi.abstract: The message body to use instead of the default message body. This value overrides the default message body.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAddressConfi.name: channelType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAddressConfi.abstract: The channel to use when sending the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAddressConfi.name: context
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAddressConfi.abstract:
An object that maps custom attributes to attributes for the address and is attached to the message. Attribute names are case sensitive.

For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAddressConfi.name: rawContent
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAddressConfi.abstract: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the message. If specified, this value overrides all other values for the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAddressConfi.name: substitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAddressConfi.abstract: A map of the message variables to merge with the variables specified by properties of the DefaultMessage object. The variables specified in this map take precedence over all other variables.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAddressConfi.name: titleOverride
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAddressConfi.abstract: The message title to use instead of the default message title. This value overrides the default message title.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.name: applicationId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.abstract: The unique identifier for the application that the campaign applies to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.name: campaignId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.abstract: The unique identifier for the campaign that the activity applies to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.name: end
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.abstract: The actual time, in ISO 8601 format, when the activity was marked CANCELLED or COMPLETED.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.name: result
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.abstract: Specifies whether the activity succeeded. Possible values are SUCCESS and FAIL.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.name: scheduledStart
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.abstract: The scheduled start time, in ISO 8601 format, for the activity.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.name: start
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.abstract: The actual start time, in ISO 8601 format, of the activity.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.name: state
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.abstract: The current status of the activity. Possible values are: PENDING, INITIALIZING, RUNNING, PAUSED, CANCELLED, and COMPLETED.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.name: successfulEndpointCount
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.abstract: The total number of endpoints that the campaign successfully delivered messages to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.name: timezonesCompletedCount
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.abstract: The total number of time zones that were completed.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.name: timezonesTotalCount
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.abstract: The total number of unique time zones that are in the segment for the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.name: totalEndpointCount
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.abstract: The total number of endpoints that the campaign attempted to deliver messages to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.name: treatmentId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivityResp.abstract: The unique identifier for the campaign treatment that the activity applies to. A treatment is a variation of a campaign that’s used for A/B testing of a campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivity.htm.name: conditionalSplit
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivity.htm.abstract: The settings for a yes/no split activity. This type of activity sends participants down one of two paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivity.htm.name: EMAIL
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivity.htm.abstract: The settings for an email activity. This type of activity sends an email message to participants.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivity.htm.name: holdout
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivity.htm.abstract: The settings for a holdout activity. This type of activity stops a journey for a specified percentage of participants.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivity.htm.name: multiCondition
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivity.htm.abstract: The settings for a multivariate split activity. This type of activity sends participants down one of as many as five paths (including a default Else path) in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivity.htm.name: randomSplit
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivity.htm.abstract: The settings for a random split activity. This type of activity randomly sends specified percentages of participants down one of as many as five paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivity.htm.name: wait
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivity.htm.abstract: The settings for a wait activity. This type of activity waits for a certain amount of time or until a specific date and time before moving participants to the next activity in a journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivitiesRe.name: item
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivitiesRe.abstract: An array of responses, one for each activity that was performed by the campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivitiesRe.name: nextToken
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingActivitiesRe.abstract: The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.
