Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSPushNoti.name: action
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSPushNoti.abstract:
The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that’s based on the message template. Valid values are:

  • OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.

  • DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of the iOS platform.

  • URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient’s device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSPushNoti.name: body
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSPushNoti.abstract: The message body to use in push notifications that are based on the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSPushNoti.name: mediaUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSPushNoti.abstract: The URL of an image or video to display in push notifications that are based on the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSPushNoti.name: rawContent
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSPushNoti.abstract: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for push notifications that are based on the message template. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSPushNoti.name: sound
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSPushNoti.abstract: The key for the sound to play when the recipient receives a push notification that’s based on the message template. The value for this key is the name of a sound file in your app’s main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your app’s data container. If the sound file can’t be found or you specify default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSPushNoti.name: title
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSPushNoti.abstract: The title to use in push notifications that are based on the message template. This title appears above the notification message on a recipient’s device.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSPushNoti.name: url
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSPushNoti.abstract: The URL to open in the recipient’s default mobile browser, if a recipient taps a push notification that’s based on the message template and the value of the Action property is URL.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: APNSPushType
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract:
The type of push notification to send. Valid values are:

  • alert - For a standard notification that’s displayed on recipients’ devices and prompts a recipient to interact with the notification.

  • background - For a silent notification that delivers content in the background and isn’t displayed on recipients’ devices.

  • complication - For a notification that contains update information for an apps complication timeline.

  • fileprovider - For a notification that signals changes to a File Provider extension.

  • mdm - For a notification that tells managed devices to contact the MDM server.

  • voip - For a notification that provides information about an incoming VoIP call.

Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-push-type request header when it sends the notification message to APNs. If you don’t specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint sets the value to alert or background automatically, based on the value that you specify for the SilentPush or RawContent property of the message.

For more information about the apns-push-type request header, see Sending Notification Requests to APNs on the Apple Developer website.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: action
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract:
The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:

  • OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.

  • DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of the iOS platform.

  • URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient’s device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: badge
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract: The key that indicates whether and how to modify the badge of your app’s icon when the recipient receives the push notification. If this key isn’t included in the dictionary, the badge doesn’t change. To remove the badge, set this value to 0.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: category
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract: The key that indicates the notification type for the push notification. This key is a value that’s defined by the identifier property of one of your app’s registered categories.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: collapseId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract:
An arbitrary identifier that, if assigned to multiple messages, APNs uses to coalesce the messages into a single push notification instead of delivering each message individually. This value can’t exceed 64 bytes.

Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-collapse-id request header when it sends the notification message to APNs.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: data
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract: The JSON payload to use for a silent push notification. This payload is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: mediaUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract: The URL of an image or video to display in the push notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: preferredAuthenticationMethod
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract: The authentication method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use when authenticating with APNs, CERTIFICATE or TOKEN.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: priority
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract:
para>5 - Low priority, the notification might be delayed, delivered as part of a group, or throttled.

/listitem>

  • 10 - High priority, the notification is sent immediately. This is the default value. A high priority notification should trigger an alert, play a sound, or badge your app’s icon on the recipient’s device.

    • /para>

    Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-priority request header when it sends the notification message to APNs.

    The equivalent values for Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), are normal, for 5, and high, for 10. If you specify an FCM value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint accepts and converts the value to the corresponding APNs value.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: rawContent
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract:
The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message.

If you specify the raw content of an APNs push notification, the message payload has to include the content-available key. The value of the content-available key has to be an integer, and can only be 0 or 1. If you’re sending a standard notification, set the value of content-available to 0. If you’re sending a silent (background) notification, set the value of content-available to 1. Additionally, silent notification payloads can’t include the alert, badge, or sound keys. For more information, see Generating a Remote Notification and Pushing Background Updates to Your App on the Apple Developer website.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: silentPush
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract:
Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification. A silent (or background) push notification isn’t displayed on recipients’ devices. You can use silent push notifications to make small updates to your app, or to display messages in an in-app message center.

Amazon Pinpoint uses this property to determine the correct value for the apns-push-type request header when it sends the notification message to APNs. If you specify a value of true for this property, Amazon Pinpoint sets the value for the apns-push-type header field to background.

If you specify the raw content of an APNs push notification, the message payload has to include the content-available key. For silent (background) notifications, set the value of content-available to 1. Additionally, the message payload for a silent notification can’t include the alert, badge, or sound keys. For more information, see Generating a Remote Notification and Pushing Background Updates to Your App on the Apple Developer website.

Apple has indicated that they will throttle “excessive” background notifications based on current traffic volumes. To prevent your notifications being throttled, Apple recommends that you send no more than 3 silent push notifications to each recipient per hour.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: sound
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract: The key for the sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification. The value for this key is the name of a sound file in your app’s main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your app’s data container. If the sound file can’t be found or you specify default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: substitutions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract: The default message variables to use in the notification message. You can override these default variables with individual address variables.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: threadId
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract: The key that represents your app-specific identifier for grouping notifications. If you provide a Notification Content app extension, you can use this value to group your notifications together.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: timeToLive
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract:
The amount of time, in seconds, that APNs should store and attempt to deliver the push notification, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the first time. If this value is 0, APNs treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service doesn’t store or try to deliver the notification again.

Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-expiration request header when it sends the notification message to APNs.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: title
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract: The title to display above the notification message on the recipient’s device.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..name: url
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingAPNSMessage..abstract: The URL to open in the recipient’s default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.name: action
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.abstract:
The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:

  • OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.

  • DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of the Android platform.

  • URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient’s device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.name: consolidationKey
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.abstract: An arbitrary string that indicates that multiple messages are logically the same and that Amazon Device Messaging (ADM) can drop previously enqueued messages in favor of this message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.name: data
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.abstract: The JSON data payload to use for the push notification, if the notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.name: expiresAfter
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.abstract: The amount of time, in seconds, that ADM should store the message if the recipient’s device is offline. Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the expiresAfter parameter when it sends the notification message to ADM.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.name: iconReference
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.abstract: The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.name: imageIconUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.abstract: The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the push notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.name: imageUrl
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.abstract: The URL of an image to display in the push notification.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.name: MD5
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.abstract: The base64-encoded, MD5 checksum of the value specified by the Data property. ADM uses the MD5 value to verify the integrity of the data.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.name: rawContent
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.abstract: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.name: silentPush
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.abstract: Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification, which is a push notification that doesn’t display on a recipient’s device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app’s configuration or supporting phone home functionality.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.name: smallImageIconUrl

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.name: sound
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingADMMessage.h.abstract: The sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that’s bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.

Classes/AWSPinpointEventRecorder.html#/c.name: diskByteLimit

Events that fail due to the device being offline will stop the submission process and be kept. Events that fail due to other reasons (such as the event being invalid) will be marked dirty and moved to a dirty table.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecencyDimen.name: AWSPinpointTargetingRecencyDimension
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecencyDimen.abstract: Specifies criteria for including or excluding endpoints from a segment based on how recently an endpoint was active.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.name: AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderConfigurationResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingRecommenderC.abstract: Provides information about Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for retrieving and processing data from a recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingResultRow.ht.name: AWSPinpointTargetingResultRow
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingResultRow.ht.abstract: Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingResultRowVal.name: AWSPinpointTargetingResultRowValue
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingResultRowVal.abstract: Provides a single value and metadata about that value as part of an array of query results for a standard metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: Specifies the status and settings of the SMS channel for an application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSChannelRe.abstract: Provides information about the status and settings of the SMS channel for an application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage.h.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSMessage.h.abstract: Specifies the default settings for a one-time SMS message that’s sent directly to an endpoint.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be used in text messages that are sent through the SMS channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSMSTemplateR.abstract: Provides information about the content and settings for a message template that can be used in text messages that are sent through the SMS channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSchedule.htm.abstract: Specifies the schedule settings for a campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentBehav.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentBehaviors
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentBehav.abstract: Specifies dimension settings for including or excluding endpoints from a segment based on how recently an endpoint was active.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentCondi.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentCondition
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentCondi.abstract: Specifies a segment to associate with an activity in a journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDemog.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDemographics
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDemog.abstract: Specifies demographic-based dimension settings for including or excluding endpoints from a segment. These settings derive from characteristics of endpoint devices, such as platform, make, and model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimen.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimensions
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentDimen.abstract: Specifies the dimension settings for a segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.abstract: Specifies the base segments and dimensions for a segment, and the relationships between these base segments and dimensions.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroupList
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentGroup.abstract: Specifies the settings that define the relationships between segment groups for a segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImpor.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImportResource
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentImpor.abstract: Provides information about the import job that created a segment. An import job is a job that creates a user segment by importing endpoint definitions.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentLocat.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentLocation
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentLocat.abstract: Specifies geographical dimension settings for a segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRefer.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentReference
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRefer.abstract: Specifies the segment identifier and version of a segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentRespo.abstract: Provides information about the configuration, dimension, and other settings for a segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentsResp.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentsResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSegmentsResp.abstract: Provides information about all the segments that are associated with an application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMessageRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.abstract: Specifies the configuration and other settings for a message to send to all the endpoints that are associated with a list of users.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMessageResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSendUsersMes.abstract: Provides information about which users and endpoints a message was sent to.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSetDimension.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSetDimension
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSetDimension.abstract: Specifies the dimension type and values for a segment dimension.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleCondit.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleCondition
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleCondit.abstract: Specifies a condition to evaluate for an activity in a journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmail..name: AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmail
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmail..abstract: Specifies the contents of an email message, composed of a subject, a text part, and an HTML part.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmailP.name: AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmailPart
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingSimpleEmailP.abstract: Specifies the subject or body of an email message, represented as textual email data and the applicable character set.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingStartConditi.name: AWSPinpointTargetingStartCondition
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingStartConditi.abstract: Specifies the conditions for the first activity in a journey. This activity and its conditions determine which users are participants in a journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTagsModel.ht.name: AWSPinpointTargetingTagsModel
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTagsModel.ht.abstract: Specifies the tags (keys and values) for an application, campaign, message template, or segment.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplate.htm.name: AWSPinpointTargetingTemplate
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplate.htm.abstract: Specifies the name and version of the message template to use for the message.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateActi.name: AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateActiveVersionRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateActi.abstract: Specifies which version of a message template to use as the active version of the template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateConf.name: AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateConfiguration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateConf.abstract: Specifies the message template to use for the message, for each type of channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.name: AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateResp.abstract: Provides information about a message template that’s associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.name: AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVersionResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.abstract: Provides information about a specific version of a message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.name: AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVersionsResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplateVers.abstract: Provides information about all the versions of a specific message template.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplatesRes.name: AWSPinpointTargetingTemplatesResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTemplatesRes.abstract: Provides information about all the message templates that are associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTreatmentRes.name: AWSPinpointTargetingTreatmentResource
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingTreatmentRes.abstract: Specifies the settings for a campaign treatment. A treatment is a variation of a campaign that’s used for A/B testing of a campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateAttrib.name: AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateAttributesRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateAttrib.abstract: Specifies one or more attributes to remove from all the endpoints that are associated with an application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.name: AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecommenderConfiguration
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingUpdateRecomm.abstract: Specifies Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for retrieving and processing recommendation data from a recommender model.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.name: AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannelRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.abstract: Specifies the status and settings of the voice channel for an application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.name: AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannelResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceChannel.abstract: Provides information about the status and settings of the voice channel for an application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceMessage.name: AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceMessage
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceMessage.abstract: Specifies the settings for a one-time voice message that’s sent directly to an endpoint through the voice channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplateRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be used in messages that are sent through the voice channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.name: AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplateResponse
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingVoiceTemplat.abstract: Provides information about the content and settings for a message template that can be used in messages that are sent through the voice channel.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWaitActivity.name: AWSPinpointTargetingWaitActivity
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWaitActivity.abstract: Specifies the settings for a wait activity in a journey. This type of activity waits for a certain amount of time or until a specific date and time before moving participants to the next activity in a journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWaitTime.htm.name: AWSPinpointTargetingWaitTime
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWaitTime.htm.abstract: Specifies a duration or a date and time that indicates when Amazon Pinpoint determines whether an activity’s conditions have been met or an activity moves participants to the next activity in a journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteApplica.name: AWSPinpointTargetingWriteApplicationSettingsRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteApplica.abstract: Specifies the default settings for an application.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.name: AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaignRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteCampaig.abstract: Specifies the configuration and other settings for a campaign.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteEventSt.name: AWSPinpointTargetingWriteEventStream
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteEventSt.abstract: Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an event stream to publish events to and the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role to use when publishing those events.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.name: AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourneyRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteJourney.abstract: Specifies the configuration and other settings for a journey.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteSegment.name: AWSPinpointTargetingWriteSegmentRequest
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteSegment.abstract: Specifies the configuration, dimension, and other settings for a segment. A WriteSegmentRequest object can include a Dimensions object or a SegmentGroups object, but not both.

Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteTreatme.name: AWSPinpointTargetingWriteTreatmentResource
Classes/AWSPinpointTargetingWriteTreatme.abstract: Specifies the settings for a campaign treatment. A treatment is a variation of a campaign that’s used for A/B testing of a campaign.

Type%20Definitions.html.name: Type Definitions
Type%20Definitions.html.abstract: The following type definitions are available globally.
